plugins.name: AI Task Manager with Jira
plugins.description:
Built by the creators of Siri, DesignPro is a simple, AI-driven task manager for Figma. It analyzes your data streams to generate accurate tasks within seconds. It also links tasks to Figma designs, enabling you to streamline work without leaving the canvas.


⏱️ Generate tasks in seconds

DesignPro’s AI will analyze your Figma comments, Figjam stickies, Slack threads, Google Docs and Google Meets/Zoom and generate accurate tasks in seconds so that you can get clarity and alignment. Easily link tasks to frames to navigate designs.


🏠 Unify tasks in one place

Unify tasks from your data streams and Jira into a single place so that you improve transparency. Easily search and organize tasks by themes, so you never lose track again.


👀 Easily manage Jira tasks in Figma

Import Jira tasks into Figma and link them to your frames so that you can view Jira tasks alongside your design work and reduce the need for context switching. Automatically sync with Jira to keep collaborators updated on progress.


🥇Trained on best-practices

DesignPro's AI is fine-tuned using feedback from our panel of expert designers from Apple, Google, Meta and Stanford d.school. It provides the highest quality reviews to help your team enhance your designs quickly and efficiently within Figma.


Learn more about the plugin and how it works on our website or watch a demo video.


Need help? Contact our founder at mscarim@designpro.ai
plugins.tagline: Generate accurate tasks with AI from your comments, stickies, transcripts, slack, docs and Jira.

plugins.name: Semantic Versioning
plugins.description:
Simplified Semantic Versioning for your Figma Nodes without external dependencies and consumable via API.


Features:

  • Guided Semantic Versioning for your Nodes.
  • Issue Figma Document-Versions alongside the node versions.
  • History (and undo) the versioning.
  • Commit Messages
  • Consumable version information via Figma REST-API


This plugin intents to help you keeping track of changes to your design by simply attaching a version number to your nodes.


The version number might be used to indicate the expected backend work triggered by the current design changes.


And it also allows you to reference the version in other tools and assets like issue trackers and documentation.


This plugin has no external dependencies, the version information is saved in the current document.


Be aware the meaning of the word "backend" depends highly on your project setup. In a progressive web app the "backend" is usually a front-end implementation whereas backend in a classical server-based webpage will be the actual server-side webapp implementation.


How to use this Plugin?

Select one or more nodes and run the plugin. If you're not selecting any nodes the plugin will show all versioned nodes on your current page.


How to use the Version Workflow?

The version number consist of three to four numerical parts:


MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH(-rfc.RFC)


The Rfc-part in brackets is optional and depends on the "requests for comments" setting.

The numbers are supposed to increment only.


MAJOR

The MAJOR-release number increase marks a backward-incompatible change of your design.


Imagine you changed a frame containing a form by removing an input. As you might assume this will break the current implementation of the app using this design because the app actually works with that input and might expect a value attached to it.


Propagating this change will likely break the backend-implementation. You communicate this by increasing the major release number by one actually saying this is a backward-incompatible change. And you expect it to break the current implementation.


MINOR

The MINOR-release number increase marks a backward-compatible change of your design, usually by adding a feature.


Imagine you extended the functionality of a frame by changing the design to display an additional input element. While this will require backend work to make the input actually work, rolling out the design won't break the application. So that is a backward compatible change of the current design.


Increasing the MINOR release version communicates you added a change which might require backend work but won't break the current backend implementation.


PATCH

The PATCH-release number increase marks a simple fix of your design which does not require any backend work.


Let's say you adjust some colors or got a ticket telling you a responsiveness feature isn't working as expected. By fixing this you correct the intentional implementation of the current design.


By using the PATCH version number you communicate there is no change in the backend-interface of your design and it won't require any backend changes.


RFC

Depending on your surrounding development process you might not be able to decide on your own when a design is ready to release. In this case you may enable the "request for comments"-based workflow.


The Rfc-workflow adds a -rfc.1-label to the version reflecting the current iteration in your approval process.


Let's say you make a first draft of a form, since it's a minor change, you choose to add a minor-change and because you have the rfc-workflow enabled you're only minor release option (given your current version is 1.0.0) is 1.1.0-rfc.1. This communicates you drafted a first version of the intended minor change.

Your team then discusses your draft and gives you some feedback which requires changes. After these changes you increase the Rfc number resulting in 1.1.0-rfc.2. After another discussion with your team all are fine with the changes and you release the design to 1.1.0.


How to use the Settings?

The settings are saved per page. That said you will have to adjust the settings once per page.


Use "request for comments"

Checking this option enables a "pre-release" path for your versioning which adds the -rfc.<<number>> counter to the version.


Using this feature allows you to mark your changes as a "proposal" depending on the workflow your design work is embedded in.


Unchecking this option changes only the available options for you next version change and does not automatically change any saved versions in the document.


Use commit messages

Checking this option shows a text field to take a optional commit message. The draft of a commit message is internally saved in the node. The commit message is saved in a small history (currently up to 5 elements) being consumabe via the Figma API.


Use version appendix at Node names

Checking this option enables @-prefixed version appendices for node names. When you save a version on a node, an @-symbol will be added to node name (if it not already exists) and the saved version is appended to the name.


This feature also adds two more version options "From Appendix" and "To Appendix" to the user interface (if the version appendix and the internal version of that node differ) allowing you to f.e. manually set or remove the version. Please keep in mind that 0.x versions are not supported by this plugin.


Unchecking this option does currently not remove any version appendices. If you want to remove any version appendices from your nodes you will have to do this manually at the moment.


Issue the save of a new Figma file version..

With this option enabled, the plugin will submit any version change (may it be Initial, Major, Minor, Patch, Rfc or Release) to the Figma version history (https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/360038006754-View-a-file-s-version-history).


The version title will be "Nodename@Version" and the description will be the commit message if enabled and provided.



API

Purpose of this interface is to provide external access to the stored version number and the retained commit history per node.


Please consult the repository for more information: https://github.com/florianb/figma-semantic-versioning#api

plugins.name: Color Knobs
plugins.description:
Create stunning color palettes in seconds with Color Knobs, a simple yet powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your design process. With just 4 intuitive sliders—Color Number, Hue, Saturation, and Lightness—you can craft the perfect color scheme for your projects.


Key Features:


4 Simple Sliders 

Adjust Color Number, Hue, Saturation, and Lightness to create custom palettes.


Real-time Preview 

Instantly see changes as you adjust your color settings.


Unlimited Color Grouping 

Organize and group colors without any limitations.


Create Figma Variables 

Seamlessly integrate your palettes by creating Figma variables directly from the plugin.

plugins.name: URL Navigation
plugins.description:
What is does

A simple plugin to navigate to different nodes of a file with external design links. It accepts a design link for a node in the file and locates and focuses on the node if it exists, with out the need to open another tab or another design window to find the node.


How it does it

  • Accept a design link
  • Check if the link is for the current design file
  • Check if the node exist
  • Select and navigate to node
  • Show appropriate error messages
plugins.tagline: A simple same file URL navigation plugin without page reload

plugins.name: Summarize AI - Free Unlimited Use
plugins.description:
Save time on lengthy feedback and complex documents — instantly Summarize them to help you make quick, informed decisions. You can also use Rewrite feature to give you 5 suggestions and Fix Spelling to polish your text. Try it out for FREE!


How to Use

  1. Select a Text
  2. Choose to Summarize, Rewrite or Fix Grammar
  3. Click one of the results to replace your Text (or copy to the clipboard if no text selected)


Features

  1. ✨ Summarize (3 results) - Great for summarizing feedbacks or documentations.
  2. ✏️ Rewrite (5 results) - Best for improving text for website and app designs.
  3. 🔨 Fix Spelling (1 best result) - Corrects grammar mistakes.
  4. 👈 Auto Replace - Turn on to instantly replace the selected text with the first result.
  5. 🌐 Output Language (20 languages) - Select language you want the output to be.


Tips

  1. This plugin works well on any Text, FigJam's StickyNote and FigJam's ShapeWithText.
  2. If your text length is too long, try split into multiple text elements.


Free Version

  1. Unlimited access to all features.
  2. Text length is limited to 200 characters per request to keep server costs low.


Paid Version

A monthly plan or 50% OFF annual plan.

  1. Unlimited access to all features and future updates.
  2. Text length increases to 4,000 characters per request.


Cancelation

Subscriptions are handled by Figma. You can cancel subscription by:

  1. Click your profile avatar in the top-left corner of Figma
  2. Click Settings
  3. Click Community and find the section Community purchases.
  4. Click the three dots ••• next to Summarize AI
  5. Click Manage subscription
  6. In the newly opened Stripe portal, select Cancel Plan


About Data


1. Data We Do Not Store

We do not retain or store any textual content submitted by users. All text data is processed through our fine-tuning model and transmitted to Claude AI (operated by Anthropic) for processing. By using our service, you acknowledge and consent that your submitted content is subject to Anthropic's Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


2. Data We Store

We maintain minimal user data limited to: Figma user IDs (numeric format) solely for the purpose of payment verification and subscription management.


3. Data Processing

Your submitted content is processed on a transient basis solely for the purpose of AI model fine-tuning and generation. Data transmission to Anthropic's Claude AI is conducted in accordance with applicable data protection regulations.


4. Data Retention

Figma's user IDs are retained only for the duration of the usage by applicable law. All other data is processed in real-time and is not permanently stored on our servers.


5. Data Security

We implement industry-standard security measures to protect stored Figma user IDs.


6. Updates to This Policy

We may update this privacy policy as needed. Users can view the changes in Figma's community plugin description (this page).


Credit: Preview mobile screens by DI_Designing

accepted.name: Saranomy
accepted.description: I make premium Figma Plugins

plugins.tagline: Summarize feedbacks, documents, sticky notes

plugins.name: Material Color Picker
plugins.description:
Choose wonderful color and get copy the color by clicking the pill and use it like a charm.


Colors can also be described by their hue, saturation, and lightness. Hue refers to the basic color, such as red, green, or blue. Saturation refers to the amount of gray in a color. A highly saturated color is pure, while a desaturated color has some gray mixed in. Lightness refers to how dark or light a color is. A light color has a lot of white mixed in, while a dark color has a lot of black mixed in.

plugins.name: Inspect Style
plugins.description:
Inspect Style is a versatile Figma plugin designed to simplify style inspection within your Figma projects. With a focus on ease of use and efficiency, this plugin enables users to quickly analyze and gather information about the styles utilized on the current page of their Figma files.


  1. Typography Insight: Dive deep into font details directly in the tab.
  2. Color Exploration: View and analyze colors used in your project for a comprehensive understanding.
  3. Toggle Views: Easily switch between current page and selected pages for tailored style inspection.
  4. Page Statistics: Explore comprehensive design statistics with ease.
  5. Rogue Styles:
  • Colors: Easily spot those with hexadecimal names (e.g., #FFFFFF).
  • Typography: Fonts without associated styles are now neatly listed in a separate section.
plugins.tagline: Quickly analyze and gather information about the styles utilized across the pages

74820.description:
Inspect Style is a versatile Figma plugin designed to simplify style inspection within your Figma projects. With a focus on ease of use and efficiency, this plugin enables users to quickly analyze and gather information about the styles utilized on the current page of their Figma files.


  1. Typography Insight: Dive deep into font details directly in the tab.
  2. Color Exploration: View and analyze colors used in your project for a comprehensive understanding.
  3. Toggle Views: Easily switch between current page and selected pages for tailored style inspection.
  4. Page Statistics: Explore comprehensive design statistics with ease.
  5. Rogue Styles:
  • Colors: Easily spot those with hexadecimal names (e.g., #FFFFFF).
  • Typography: Fonts without associated styles are now neatly listed in a separate section.
74820.release_notes: Quickly identify rogue styles!  Now you can instantly find and list colors and typography used without linked styles, helping you maintain consistency and manage your design system effortlessly.
74820.tagline: Quickly analyze and gather information about the styles utilized across the pages

plugins.name: Atmos
plugins.description:
Atmos has everything you need to create color palettes for UI. Quickly and easily create beautiful, uniform, accessible palettes and save hours and save hours juggling with a dozen of other tools.


Atmos comes with all the tools one would need to create a great color palette:


- Color generator that creates semantic colors along with brand colors

- Shade generator with easing curves and hue shifting

- Advanced LCH and OKLCH editor for fine-tuning palettes to perfection (we call it Playground)

- Color wheel for cases where you don't want too much randomness

- WCAG 2 and APCA contrast checker along with a vision simulator

- And many quality-of-life things like import, export...


Visit the website to learn more:

plugins.name: Superfun! - UI Development Studio
plugins.description:
Welcome to the future of design and development collaboration! As professionals, we understand the complexities and demands you face when transforming your intricate Figma designs into fully functional code. That's why we've developed Superfun, the expert-driven Figma plug-in that caters to both designers and developers, refining and elevating your design-to-code conversion process.


Leveraging our expertise in the field, Superfun expertly mitigates pain points that arise when translating design to code:


  1. Labor-intensive manual conversion and collaboration
  2. Risk of miscommunication between design and development teams
  3. Preservation of design integrity amidst coding constraints


Superfun is your key to conquering these challenges. Meticulously crafted by industry veterans, our plug-in optimizes the conversion process, ensuring your designs are precisely translated into clean, maintainable HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code.


🪄 Automatically convert your Figma designs into HTML, React, Vue or Svelte code.

With Superfun, you can prepare your designs for developers by turning them into code that a Senior Developer would create. Choose between HTML or do the heavy lifting and turn them in React, Vue or Svelte with your choice of inline styles, CSS or even with Tailwind!


🤖 Add interactivity to your code.

Superfun will intelligently identify buttons, inputs and forms. We'll even add the javascript, or write the framework specific code to make sure it works for everyone.


🚀 Share a fully functioning website

You know how we all have ideas, but it's hard to get them out of our heads and into our projects? We can help you do that. Just open your design in CodeSandbox and share with the world. Get fully functional code that can be integrated with your existing projects.


What makes this tool so important?

  • Our plugin runs locally on your computer, meaning that your design and code are not shared with anyone else.
  • We have designed and developed this plugin out of our commitment to our craft, with best practices always in mind, rather than for any profit.


Join the elite community of top-tier designers and developers who rely on CodeCraft Pro to streamline their design-to-code conversion process. Experience the transformative impact of a professional-grade tool on your workflow.


We're still in beta, so as more people use the tool, we learn more about how to translate that content into code. If you're not getting the results you expected, there are plenty of ways to create and organize designs in Figma. We emphasize the use of helpful layout tools such as Auto-Layout, spacing, and components, to name a few. Sure, you can make an artboard with a bunch of jumbled elements and it'll still work, but it won't be the most effective option.


💅 Dig what you see?

You can hire us to help your team build faster with design systems, plugins and automations - drew@reallygood.work
plugins.tagline: Masterfully Address Design-to-Code Challenges Supports HTML, React, Vue, Svelte and Tailwind.

plugins.name: Text Renamer
plugins.description:
TextRenamer is a simple yet powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of renaming text styles.


With its intuitive interface, you can effortlessly update and manage text style names in bulk, saving you valuable time and effort.


Whether you need to perform a simple name change or execute complex search and replace operations, TextRenamer has got you covered.


How to Use:

  1. Install the TextRenamer plugin from the Figma plugin library.
  2. Open your Figma document and access the text styles within the document.
  3. Rename the names individually, in groups, or perform a search and replace operation with keywords.
  4. Apply the renaming operation to instantly update your text styles.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Rename & Update Text Styles. Bulk Find & Replace Made Easy!

plugins.description:
SeCo is a simple tool that allows you to quickly find brands & other properties from simpleicons.org.


Features

✨ Import colours & icons from brands, like twitter, facebook, and many more!

✨ Place SVGs without the frame!

✨ Sort items alphabetically or by colour

✨ Quick Search / Auto complete!

✨ Docked Favourites at the top of your list for easy access!


How to use this plugin

Simply search for the icon you're looking for, and click on the tile representing your query. plugins.name: Page Numbering
plugins.description:
1. Create a page number component. Customize the location and font however you want.
  2. Add instances of the page number component to slides
  3. Click on the page number master component (select it). Click Generate




Essential Tips:

  1. Make sure to have a text layer in your master page number component. The plugin uses the text layer to generate numbers.
  2. The plugin will search the file for all child components, so make sure that every page you want to label has a page number child component
  3. Make sure that the page number child component is a direct descendant to the slide. Do not put the child component in a group or nest it.
  4. The page numbering will go left to right first then top down.
  5. Make sure that your slides are organized/aligned well. The plugin uses the coordinates of the slide to determine what number goes on that slide. To organize the slides, try using auto layout on the slides
  6. To redo the page numbering, just select on the master component again and click generate
plugins.tagline: Generate page numbers using your own customized page number component

81861.description:

  4. The page numbering will go left to right first then top down.

plugins.name: FRONT-END.AI
plugins.description:
FRONT-END.AIユーザー専用プラグインです。

FRONT-END.AIを利用するために必要な情報をダウンロードできます。


■ FRONT-END.AIとは

FRONT-END.AIはWebエンジニア向けのローコードサービスで、デザインデータのレイヤー構造を修正することなく、デザインカンプ(jpg)とアセット一式をアップロードすることで、日米特許取得済の「デザインを理解するAI」がhtml / css ※を自動生成するWebサービスです。ユーザーは生成された結果を必要に応じて、Web上で解析結果を編集することができ、コードをダウンロードできます。

本プラグインを用いて、書き出したレイヤー情報データと一緒にカンプ、アセットファイルをアップロードすることでより正確なテキストや画像を取得することができます。従来から提供している「デザインを理解するAI」と組み合わさることにより、生成されるhtmlの精度も大幅に向上いたします。

（※cssは一部）


※本プラグインはFRONT-END.AI契約者向けプラグインです。


FRONT-END.AI をご利用になりたい方は、

https://front-end.ai からお申し込み下さい。




■ 使い方

  1. Figma上で、画像として書き出したいレイヤーに書き出し設定をします。
  2. フレームを選択し、FRONT-END.AIプラグインを起動し、zipファイルをダウンロードします。

plugins.name: Adee - Accessibility Tools, Contrast Check & Code Generator
plugins.description:
Adee Accessibility Plugin Features for Figma



Color Contrast Checker: Allows users to assess and adjust the contrast between text and background colors to ensure they meet accessibility standards, essential for readability by users with visual impairments. Features include swiping layers and colors, a live preview, and the ability to undo changes and apply them to designs. It also facilitates sharing of contrast test results with team members.

Colorblind Automatic Checker and Simulation: Automatically checks and simulates how individuals with different types of color blindness perceive colors. This feature supports visualizing eight forms of color blindness, including a black and white simulation, and allows designers to compare modes and views. Results can be shared with the team, enhancing collaboration and ensuring that designs are accessible to a broader audience.

Alt Text Generator: Automates the creation of alternative text for images in SVG, PNG, and JPG formats. It automatically detects image formats and allows users to specify the purpose of the image (informative/decorative), include image titles and descriptions, and suggest relevant HTML tags. This tool supports bulk operations and sharing capabilities, crucial for making content accessible to visually impaired users.

Touch Target Check: Ensures interactive elements such as buttons and links meet size standards for touch interaction across various devices, including Apple and Android devices, based on guidelines from Nielsen and WCAG. It provides a detailed testing interface and smart suggestions to meet these standards, ensuring designs are accessible on touch devices.

Accessibility HTML Generator: Converts design elements into HTML code that incorporates best practices in web accessibility, including semantic structures and ARIA roles. This tool aids in enhancing the usability of designs for users relying on assistive technologies.

Accessibility Checklist: Offers a comprehensive list of accessibility standards and guidelines to review against the design, ensuring all elements comply with best practices and helping designers maintain accessibility throughout their projects.


Contact us: hello@adee.co

Website: adee.co

accepted.name: Adee
accepted.description: Adee is an accessibility testing plugin designed to integrate with design tools like Figmaenhancing the design process.

plugins.name: Cloneify
plugins.description:
Meet Cloneify, your new design sidekick on Figma.


Designed to simplify your design workflow, Cloneify allows you to clone the style properties from one object and seamlessly apply them to multiple selected objects with just a single click.


How does it work?

  1. Select an object(s)
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Select the desired object you want to clone. Boom!


Say goodbye to the tedious task of manually adjusting each element for style consistency.


Whether you're working on a complex UI project or ensuring uniform branding, Cloneify makes the process quick, efficient, and error-free.


Experience a smoother, faster, and more consistent design process with Cloneify.


Your feedback will help us continue to improve and grow.

plugins.name: Advanced Page Organizer
plugins.description:
Advanced page organizer


Streamline your design process with this simple drag and drop plugin. The plugin lets you create folder-page structure in your figma file. The folders and pages can be easily re-ordered, deleted or renamed using this plugin. There is also ability to use page templates if you are starting a project from scratch. 


How it works

  1. Run Advanced Page Organizer ⭐️
  2. Create folders and you can move all related pages inside the folder. 
  3. If you wish to not have the page/folder emojis you can change it from preferences.
  4. "Section dividers" helps you to create an empty page to reduce the clutter. 
  5. If you wish to use page templates, head to the "Page Templates" tab within the plugin and select a plugin that suits you. New pages will be added to the end of your file. It doesn't affect your current pages. ✨
  6. Update Pages


Feedback and suggestions

If you have any suggestions of improvements or you face any issues please leave a comment. I will get back to you at the earliest.

accepted.name: Arun
accepted.description: Product Designer creating tools that streamline design process and improve workflow of designers everywhere.

plugins.tagline: Organize your figma pages with this drag and drop tool

plugins.name: Translation Suggestions
plugins.description:
Get translation suggestions for multiple languages while editing text with using a plugin with text review capability.


Translation Suggestions is a plugin with text review capability that automatically launches as soon as you enter text editing mode and shows translation suggestions in the context menu.


Get started:

  1. Run the plugin;
  2. Allow using Translation Suggestions as a text review plugin in the opened modal window (you can also select this from Figma main menu > Text > Text review plugins > Translation Suggestions);
  3. Select the target languages you need;
  4. Close the plugin window.


How to get translation suggestions:

  1. Select any text object and enter edit mode;
  2. Call the context menu by right-clicking on the text highlighted with a blue wavy line to see the suggestions.


Supported objects:

  1. Texts;
  2. Connectors;
  3. Shapes with text (Square, Ellipse, Diamond, etc.);
  4. Sticky notes;
  5. Widgets;
  6. Tables.


Tip:

To quickly search for selected (checked) languages in the plugin UI, you can write check in the search input field.


Translations are by Google Translate engine.


Donation:

You can support the development and maintenance of this plugin by donating via destream.


Creator:

Yury Zeliankouski


My other projects:

  1. Glyphs plugin;
  2. Change Font plugin;
  3. Code Block to File plugin;
  4. Base64 plugin;
  5. Translate widget;
  6. How many Sticky Notes? widget.

accepted.name: Yury Zeliankouski
accepted.description:
UX/UI designer. Figma expert. Developer of plugins and widgets for Figma and FigJam.

plugins.name: Magia Record Character Grid Creator Interface
plugins.description:
This plugin is for creating a grid view of your Magical Girls in the game Magia Record: Puella Magi Madoka Magica Side Story (https://magiarecord-en.com/). The game does not include a good overview for displaying all you owned Magical Girls and how awakened and upgraded they are, so this plugin creates that view as image for easy sharing.

Installing the Plugin
1. Duplicate the Figma project (https://www.figma.com/file/jcgWY0YGzPbAwBp47LV3oL/Magia-Record-Character-Grids). 
2. Install the plugin and open the Magia Record Character Grids Project.
3. Right click on the background or go to the hamburger menu and select Plugins > Magia Record Character Grid Creator Interface
4. The HTML window for the plugin will open.

Features
1. Create a fully detailed Character Displays for your Magical Girls, including: Character Card, Stars (Rank), Attribute, Experience Level, Magic Level, Magia Level, and Episode Level.
2. Available values for each field are automatically filled in and available for selection for easy creation.
3. Update an existing Character Display if a mistake was made or as you progress though the game.
4. Copy the properties of an existing Character Display to create a new or update an existing one.
5. Automatic placement of newly created Character Displays with respect to the selected Character Display or parent Frame.
6. Convert copied Character Display frames from one file to another file to work with the new file.
7. Group and Sort Character Displays in a frame based on selected properties.
8. Set Backgrounds for the frames containing Character Displays.

Usage

Create new Character Display
1. Either select an existing instance or frame (can be the document itself)
2. Select the properties you want.
3. Press Create.

Update an Existing Character Display
1. Select an existing instance of a Character Display.
2. Press the Copy and all properties appear in fields.
3. Modify the fields you want to update.
3. Press Update. 

Create new Character Display with Existing Properties
1. Select an existing instance of a Character Display.
2. Press the Copy and all properties appear in fields.
3. Modify any fields if desired.
4. Press Create.

Convert Copied Character Displays from Another File
1. Copy and paste either a Character Display instance(s) or an entire frame containing all the instances to convert from one file to another. Once pasted, all the instances will become frames as they are no longer attached to their master components. All the names of all the layers must match the original components.
2. Select the Character Display frame(s) or parent frame (where all the children are Character Display frames) you want to convert.
3. Press Convert and a toast message will show how many were converted or skipped.
4. All the frames that were copy and pasted over are now converted to instances for which their master components are in the current document. 

Grouping and Sorting List
1. Navigate to the Sorting tab.
2. Select a frame containing only Character Displays.
3. Select the property to group by, the property(s) to sort by, the grouping and sorting direction(s), the direction to sort the ID's (the last property to sort by), and the number of Character Displays per row.
4. Press Sort.

Adding Background to List
1. Navigate to the Background Tab.
2. Select the frame you want to add a background to.
3. Select the Background Type and Background Name you want to add to the frame. You can see the available backgrounds in the Background Page.
4. Press Create/Update.

Resizing Existing Background
1. Navigate to the Background Tab.
2. Select the frame you want to add a background to.
3. Press Resize. You would want to do this if the frame has been resized and the background no longer fits or is no longer centered.

Removing a Background.
1. Navigate to the Background Tab.
2. Select the frame you want to remove a background from.
3. Press Remove.

3. Press Resize. You would want to do this if the frame has been resized and the background no longer fits or is no longer centered.

Removing a Background.
1. Navigate to the Background Tab.
2. Select the frame you want to remove a background from.
3. Press Remove.

plugins.name: Pixelated Censor
plugins.description:
How to Use

  1. Draw a shape (Rectangle, Ellipse, Polygon, Star, Pen, or Pencil) over the area you want to censor.
  2. Select the shape, adjust the Pixel Size, and click Apply.
  3. Optionally, select the group it creates, adjust the Pixel Size and click Update.


Use Cases

  1. Hiding sensitive information.
  2. Redacting text or images.
  3. Compliance & NDA Production.
  4. NSFW or NSFL content.


Pricing

  1. Enjoy 5 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access with free future updates for a one-time purchase.


Tips

  1. Feel free to rotate the shape however you want before applying the effect.
  2. When drawing custom shape with Pen or Pencil, the plugin will recognize the open loop and close it for you before applying the effect.
  3. After applying the effect, the pixelated_censor_group group is created. The group contains pixelated_censor_shape (your original shape) and pixelated_censor (the effect). You can edit the pixel size as long as the group still contains pixelated_censor_shape.
  4. [Figma's Issue] In some rare cases, exporting a frame with pixelated censor group(s) but no images or only JPG images may result in blurriness instead of a pixelated effect. To fix this, add a visible image to the frame and export it again.

accepted.name: Saranomy
accepted.description: I make premium Figma Plugins

plugins.tagline: Censor the area with pixelated blur effect

plugins.name: Countdown Timer
plugins.description:
Select your Text, and turn it into a Countdown Timer that everyone can see.


How to use

  1. Select a Text or ShapeWithText (FigJam) on the canvas
  2. Set the time - 90 or 1:30 for 90s. 1:00:00 for 1h
  3. Start the timer
  4. Remove the timer from the list when you are done


I use this for a lunch break and toilet break while sharing the Figma screen. People also use it for Pomodoro (25-minute work session). Do what you want with it.


Warning: Closing the plugin will stop all timers.

plugins.name: Replace with Instance
plugins.description:
Replace a frame with an instance and copy over the text.


Just select one instance or one component and multiple frames that all share the same layout. Then run the plugin and all frames will be converted to instances. The cool thing is: all texts from the original frame will be copied over to the instance.


Requirement: The instance and the frame should contain the same amount of text-fields.
plugins.tagline: Replace a frame with an instance and copy over the text and its fills.

plugins.name: Smart Cloner
plugins.description:
Make multiple renamed copies of components, frames or other layers in seconds.


• Choose direction with command and create any amount of copies at a time

• Completely keyboard accessible: name and create all of the copies in one approach to the keyboard.

• The part after the last “/” is preselected automatically (use cmd/ctrl + a to select all if needed)

• All copies would be selected and conveniently placed right under the prototype layer

• Regulate distance between copies. Plugin remembers last value for the next time.


How to use:

1. Select one layer that you want to copy. Works with Components, Frames and other types of layers.

2. Call the plugin. The plugin has 4 different commands for cloning in all 4 directions.

3. Name your copies. Use tab for creating another copy, so you can name all of them in one approach to the keyboard.

4. (Optional) Hit Shift+Tab to focus on Shift input, then type the desired distance between the copies. The plugin will remember that value next time.

4. Hit Enter to create your copies.


Also, visit this thread for video demo: https://twitter.com/aswellasyouare/status/1169334638805958658

accepted.name: Vadim Pleshkov
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Create named copy of a component or any other layer

The Chakra UI Design System is an innovative Figma plugin designed to streamline the design process for projects utilising the Chakra UI framework. By importing the Chakra UI design system directly into Figma tokens, this plugin empowers designers to kickstart their projects with ease and efficiency.

plugins.name: Spotlight Search
plugins.description:
Light plugin for fast navigation in your project. Find and jump to any Page, Frame, Component, Layer. That's it!

With the Recents section, you can quickly switch between 2-5 things to which you jumped before. Use arrow keys and return (enter on Win) to move inside the project without lifting your hands from the keyboard.

Pro tip: launch plugin with Run last plugin shortcut ⌥ ⌘ P.

I believe you are quite smart to remember the names of layers and pages. So what is the point of losing your mind finding them in the layers panel, right?

accepted.name: Vlad Solomakha
accepted.description: Co-founder @ banani.co
